name: Finland closed its border with Russia in late 2023
description: Reuters reported that Finland closed its border with Russia in late 2023 after accusing Russia of sending migrants to the frontier.

name: border crossing points on Finland’s eastern border are closed
description: The Finnish Border Guard states that border crossing points on Finland’s eastern border are closed to traffic until further notice.

description: Reuters reported that cross-border trade and tourism collapse has cost Finland’s border regions over €300 million annually.

name: The Finnish Border Guard lists railway traffic through Vainikkala
description: The Finnish Border Guard lists railway traffic through Vainikkala as an exception for commercial traffic while the eastern border crossing points are otherwise closed.

name: cargo vessel traffic may be received at the port

name: the maritime border crossing points for leisure boating at Haapasaari
description: The Finnish Border Guard states that the maritime border crossing points for leisure boating at Haapasaari and Santio are closed until further notice.

name: the President of the Republic approved the Border Security Act
description: The Ministry of the Interior states that the President of the Republic approved the Border Security Act on 16 July 2024 and that it entered into force on 22 July 2024.

name: an amendment confirmed on 27 June 2025 extended the Border
description: The Ministry of the Interior states that an amendment confirmed on 27 June 2025 extended the Border Security Act until 31 December 2026 and entered into force on 1 July 2025.

name: amendments on the use of technology in maintaining border security
description: The Ministry of the Interior states that amendments on the use of technology in maintaining border security were approved on 28 June 2024 and entered into force on 5 July 2024.

name: Finland is building a fence on the eastern border
description: The Ministry of the Interior states that Finland is building a fence on the eastern border to improve border control and support management of incidents at the border.

name: a 200-kilometre high-tech border fence is under construction along Finland’s
description: Reuters reported that a 200-kilometre high-tech border fence is under construction along Finland’s border with Russia.

name: the eastern border fence will reduce Finland’s dependence on the
description: The Ministry of the Interior states that the eastern border fence will reduce Finland’s dependence on the effectiveness of Russian border control.

name: a legislative amendment entering into force on 5 July 2024
description: The Ministry of the Interior states that a legislative amendment entering into force on 5 July 2024 expanded the Border Guard’s technical surveillance and granted new powers for radio-technology-based surveillance.

name: acts securing the Border Guard’s human resources were adopted
description: The Ministry of the Interior states that acts securing the Border Guard’s human resources were adopted on 17 May 2024 and entered into force on 15 June 2024.

name: amendments to improve conditions for combating offences investigated by the

name: comments on strengthening the Border Guard’s preparedness-related powers ran
description: The Ministry of the Interior states that comments on strengthening the Border Guard’s preparedness-related powers ran from 9 December 2025 to 21 January 2026.

name: The Ministry of the Interior lists a government Report
description: The Ministry of the Interior lists a government Report on Internal Security submitted to Parliament on 11 September 2025.

name: a legislative project on the Finnish Border Guard’s criminal intelligence
description: The Ministry of the Interior states that a legislative project on the Finnish Border Guard’s criminal intelligence activities runs from 24 November 2025 to 30 October 2026.

name: the Jaeger Brigade’s readiness unit exercise in Ivalo
description: The Finnish Army stated that the Jaeger Brigade’s readiness unit exercise RYSKE would be held in Ivalo and the Tsarmitunturi fell area on 4–11 February 2026.

name: Utti Jaeger Regiment would train in Northern Finland from 2
description: The Finnish Army stated that Utti Jaeger Regiment would train in Northern Finland from 2 February to 27 March 2026 with about 1,000 soldiers including allied-country participants.

description: The Finnish Army stated that it would exercise local defence during 20 February–6 March 2026 with up to about 3,500 soldiers and other authorities.
